definition: lantern with carousel of paper horses, rotating under convection, used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节/fig. constant busy circulation of people
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
lamp/light/lantern/CL:盞|盏[zhan3]

sentences.english: Why does the lantern turn when we light up the electric bulb?
sentences.chinese: 当我们点亮灯泡时，为什么走马灯会转动？

sentences.english: Over the past years, the "problem foods" appeared one after another.
sentences.chinese: 这几年，问题食品像走马灯似的，你方唱罢我登场。

sentences.english: The transfer of administrative personnel in that colony was so frequent as to create a kaleidoscopic effect.
sentences.chinese: 在那个殖民地，行政官员调换频繁，就像走马灯似的。

definition: to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
see 無頭蒼蠅|无头苍蝇[wu2 tou2 cang1 ying5]
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to be as if.../to be rather like...
to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms
magic trick
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
lit. each color and each form (idiom)/diverse/various/all kinds of
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
all kinds/of every description
spinning top/gyroscope
